cities.name: Addis Ababa
cities.historicalSignificance: Founded in 1886 by Emperor Menelik II, meaning 'New Flower' in Amharic
culturalFacts: Home to the African Union headquarters
Stands at 2,355 meters above sea level
Founded after Empress Taytu Betul found hot springs in the area
myths: Named by Empress Taytu for the beautiful landscape

cities.name: Lalibela
cities.historicalSignificance: Famous for rock-hewn churches from 12th century, built by King Lalibela
culturalFacts: Churches carved from solid rock below ground level
Named after King Lalibela who envisioned a 'New Jerusalem'
myths: Angels helped masons build the churches overnight

cities.name: Axum
cities.historicalSignificance: Ancient capital of the Aksumite Empire, home of the Ark of the Covenant
culturalFacts: Home to ancient obelisks and stelae
Believed to house the Ark of the Covenant
One of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in Africa
myths: Founded by son of King Solomon and Queen of Sheba
landmarks: Church of Our Lady Mary of Zion

cities.name: Gondar
cities.historicalSignificance: Former imperial capital known for its medieval castles and palaces
culturalFacts: Fasil Ghebbi fortress complex is UNESCO site
Home to the Debre Berhan Selassie Church with famous ceiling angels
myths: Founded after Emperor Fasilides followed a buffalo to a holy spring
